tweet: What does it look like to represent 8th district residents in the era of COVID-19? Here’s a typical day in a nutshell: https://t.co/0pPGSBSG4z

.@GovWhitmer's announcement on resuming manufacturing is an important step in the deliberate, careful resumption of our economy.

The next step is for every facility to carefully consider and plan for health and safety. https://t.co/10WHcqmczF

Unfortunately, not every community in our district has access to broadband internet. 

As remote work and education become the new normal, we need to see broadband as a public good that citizens deserve access to, just as they do to electricity and water. https://t.co/wV62U0VoX4

The President's veto of this legislation is disappointing but not surprising.

What is more important, and will have lasting impact, is that Congress has taken a bipartisan step to reassert its constitutional role in matters of peace and war. https://t.co/8AKkyh07rH

As the rep. of the MSU community that has been deeply affected by sexual assault, I'm disappointed @BetsyDeVosED finalized Title IX roll-backs that make it harder for survivors to come forward –– and force changes on schools disrupted by a global pandemic. https://t.co/9dMhzjbni8

Supporting small cities and towns shouldn't be a partisan issue –– it’s about beating back this virus and getting back on our feet.

@MayorBarnett, President of @usmayors, and I advocate for more support to communities fighting COVID-19 in @DetNewsOpinion: https://t.co/DxjvsQjkqk
We needed this this week. https://t.co/7umn8Dg54Q

We should get back to work in a safe and responsible way, as soon as we can. The vast majority of Michiganders recognize that to get there, we must work together –– and that in a community, we all have responsibilities to each other, especially during a crisis. https://t.co/TqxwjOKs0j

Six days a week, I can depend on @USPS to make it down the dirt road to my family farm. 

We can’t forget the postal workers keeping us connected despite COVID-19, and the lifeline they provide to rural areas across our country. 

The @USPS has my support. https://t.co/z7bQ7WpuqW
Thank you, @SenMikeShirkey. Threats and intimidation have no place in politics. https://t.co/1kGXckaKWS

In response to the few hundred protestors who showed up in our Capitol and my district today:

Americans have the right to protest. Americans have the right to make unfounded claims about the virus and dispute the death toll of 3,600 Michiganders, as many speakers did today.

On the heels of fighting to get PPE to frontline workers, states like MI must now scramble to build testing capacity.

There's a role for the Admin. to play in accelerating the flow of these supplies –– and making sure they get to areas of greatest need. https://t.co/SkAd7G6GZ1

Mr. President, as you consider efforts to secure our supply chain, don’t make this a choice between punishing China or placating China.

We should care less about what China thinks and more about what helps keep the American people safe. https://t.co/WKZZqIV5n0

If we don't allow smaller cities & towns to benefit from federal assistance, many could be forced to take drastic action––including laying off the very same personnel working on the front lines of this crisis.

I'm calling for future COVID-19 legislation to include this support: https://t.co/SkvDAIir5R

Oakland County has been hit especially hard by this virus. I’m proud to be working with State Rep. Andrea Schroeder and County Executive David Coulter to bring more testing capacity to the county –– which is key to reopening our shops and factories. https://t.co/1AdcKXx05y
Every Michigander is eager to get back to work — and the vast majority of us also recognize that the only thing worse for our economy that shutting down once would be having to do it twice.

The PPP loan program has been a lifeline for so many of our district’s small businesses –– from Cookies & Cream ice cream shop in Lake Orion, to our beloved Lansing Lugnuts, to the WorkSkills Corporation in Brighton and Dutton Farms in Rochester Hills. https://t.co/5T6R4RZ9t1

Today's must-pass bill will be a critical lifeline to small businesses. It should have included support for small & medium communities.

Police, firefighters & health dept. workers who are risking their lives on the front lines now have their jobs at risk.

They deserve better. https://t.co/nb6HqRs5Gv

Ramadan Mubarak to all those observing Islam’s holy month. COVID-19 will change iftar and daily prayers, just as it has changed Easter and Passover celebrations –– let’s all hope the day comes soon when we can gather for family and our faiths.
It was great to show @SecArmy how our entire state has pulled together in this crisis, including the tremendous contributions of @MINationalGuard. https://t.co/VGKTc7OEFA

Tomorrow I’ll be voting on a nearly $500B package that will provide a lifeline to so many of our small businesses through the PPP.

But this is a compromise bill, and I want our next package to heed the call from our state, city and local governments who need our help: https://t.co/OjEGYw8LL2

Today is #HolocaustRemembranceDay. We honor the memory of the six million Jews herded, forced into labor, and killed during the Holocaust, as well as those who bravely fought the Nazis and the evil they espoused.

Every day we don’t renew funding for the SBA’s Paycheck Protection Program loans, we put our small businesses at risk. Renewing those funds is a top priority for small businesses in our district right now, as it is for me. https://t.co/FU9OpXjoj6

Some great news: veterans who receive C&P benefits will automatically get their $1,200 stimulus checks.

Our veterans should have full access to this support, and I’m thrilled they’ll be receiving these funds without any extra paperwork or hassle. https://t.co/7xrutzWYmk

We cannot let this virus disrupt our democracy. Through prudent planning we can ensure Americans aren’t forced to choose between their democratic rights and their health and safety.

70 colleagues joined me in calling for legislation to protect the right to vote amid this crisis: https://t.co/BE8nSvTsg4

This is what it looks like when we come together to support each other.

A huge thanks to all of the businesses, individuals and organizations that have stepped up to support our frontline medical professionals with these donations –– and keep it coming! https://t.co/dY52jqccOH

Calling all high school artists! Our office is excited to announce that we are extending the deadline for submissions for the Congressional Arts Competition through May 7th.

Visit our website for more information and to submit your artwork: https://t.co/RkQhH4ZKR6
I believe strongly in the right of all Americans to protest their government, and that includes today’s protesters in their cars in Lansing –– even if I don’t agree with their premise.

Have questions about how to access resources during #COVID19? I'll be joined by experts on new small business loans for a Facebook Live Q&A at 11:00AM tomorrow.

Drop your questions in the comments below, and we'll answer them tomorrow live 👇 https://t.co/xWsB7zKTWW

Our nurses & doctors have been dependent on a supply chain for equipment that starts in China.

I’m introducing the Made in America Medical Supply Chain Initiative to harness U.S. manufacturing power so that we never again send front-line health providers into battle unarmored. https://t.co/orGG3db7Hp

We can always depend on our veterans to rise to the challenge. Becky and Brandon Penders have turned their Clarkston home into a 3D printing shop for PPE, keeping our front line providers safe and fighting #COVID19. https://t.co/Z6XlJX5TNM

This is how Andrea, a CRNA who has been moved into COVID ICU work, goes to work every day. She spends her days intubating patients & talking to families about their loved ones, since they cannot be with them.

This includes telling patients the final words from their families. https://t.co/qn2A89sSm1

#COVID19 took Opening Day from us — and for our @LansingLugnuts and other @MiLB teams, it’s been devastating.

I’m proud to join a bipartisan group urging @SBAgov to connect directly with these teams that serve as anchor businesses in so many of our communities: https://t.co/cOBXu05hC4
From a grateful community, thank you. Across Ingham, Livingston, and North Oakland Counties, 8th district residents are stepping up in so many ways: https://t.co/zRr9ZjEABf

In darkest times, Spring is a season of hope, and Easter is a reminder of renewal. #HappyEaster to all celebrating this day.

I know the hope that is such an important part of our national character will carry us through the challenges we face.

Our nurses & doctors have been dependent on a supply chain for basic supplies that starts in China. This week I announced the Made in America Medical Supply Chain Initiative to harness US manufacturing might so that we never send front-line health providers into battle unarmored. https://t.co/xgCOoAMXi2

Families with college-age kids and @michiganstateu & @oaklandu students in #MI08 are concerned that the CARES Act leaves certain college students out of direct payments.

I talked to @thesnews about a bipartisan bill I'm co-sponsoring to close this gap: https://t.co/bObTDUO8hI

As a national security professional, I find it unacceptable that we were so unprepared for #COVID19.

As a Michigander, I find it unacceptable that we're losing lives b/c we lack equipment U.S. manufacturers can make.

It’s time to do something about it. https://t.co/mEKWHr9Qki

Another big Michigan contribution to the fight against #COVID19: @michiganstateu is seeking FDA approval for a process to heat-sterilize N95 masks, working closely with @SparrowHealth.

@RepFredUpton and I are pushing hard for fast approval: https://t.co/V1MfmRR7iU

Today’s announcement of @GM’s ventilator contract to fight #COVID19 is a great example of how Michigan manufacturers are stepping up for our nation as they’ve always done.

It’s especially important that this contract has a priority rating under the DPA. https://t.co/6ezt4aY9py

This is David, a nurse from Mason, with his team. We spoke on the phone after I read the moving letter he wrote me on what it's like to work without enough PPE.

“We’re the soldiers on the front line being asked to wage war without even the bare minimum,” he wrote.

He’s right. https://t.co/QBwSkO7MoK

For two decades, summer in Michigan meant Al Kaline in the outfield at The Corner.

Even those of us who never saw him play know of his ’68 World Series heroics, his dedication to greatness and his love for Michigan. Thank you, Mr. Tiger. https://t.co/Y7ebfEsqHi

There is nothing more urgent in the fight against #COVID19 than getting protective equipment to front-line health workers.

I’m fighting alongside @GovWhitmer and the bipartisan Michigan delegation to uncover any source we can find. https://t.co/p47vjel5M3

So many crafters & sewers across our state are stepping up to make masks to protect our healthcare workers.

Kudos to the owner of Seams in East Lansing and her sewing community, who are banding together to get masks to Lansing-area healthcare facilities: https://t.co/39YnJQR0RK
While America fights #COVID19, election officials like @TLBsStory are doing prudent planning to safeguard our democratic process: https://t.co/eLQJxul6V5

In battle, the saying goes, armies march to war on their stomachs –– meaning they can’t win the battle without the supplies that keep them fed.

In the battle against #COVID19, grocery workers and shop employees are the supply heroes, helping feed us despite the risk. https://t.co/vHgtNKDmLW
#SpartansWill https://t.co/wfwzU4AzQ7

I'm so proud that @SenGaryPeters' and my Support for Veterans in Effective Apprenticeships Act has been signed into law.

I’m grateful to our National Guard soldiers and airmen for their efforts, and I’m grateful that the administration has taken this action. https://t.co/h1SUBbPL8s

That’s right — Michigan is on the case.

In a crisis, we do what Michiganders always do: we put our heads down and get to work: https://t.co/gC0Id4ZUTw

Our health care providers are at war without armor to protect them.

In the @washingtonpost, I outline five ways we can arm them with the tools to fight #COVID19: https://t.co/Z7xzlVtrsJ

There has never been a more opportune time to share a heartfelt thanks to our doctors and frontline health care workers. Every day, you are risking your lives to protect us. 

You are the best of us, and we see you for everything you’re doing right now. #NationalDoctorsDay

It takes less than 10 minutes but can bring in tens of thousands of dollars to Michigan: Remember to fill out your 2020 census before this Wednesday, April 1st. Go to https://t.co/rNJPULLUnt. https://t.co/7ObflgE4zj

A beloved state lawmaker. A WMU student. Assembly line workers, police officers, community leaders. Parents, coworkers & friends. #COVID19 is claiming lives across MI.

We can honor victims of this disease by doing all we can to stop its spread: Stay home. Stay safe. Save lives. https://t.co/XohvfprL0A

You can send a message of thanks to our front-line health care providers at St. Joe's here: https://t.co/LbtGGqdPbZ https://t.co/AsdurUlzBf

President Trump’s decision to grant @GovWhitmer’s request — one that the bipartisan Michigan congressional delegation supported — for a major disaster declaration for Michigan is a welcome step. But we have much more work to do. https://t.co/HYJEta8hgS

Gov. Gretchen Whitmer has done nothing but stand up for people of our state, especially our front-line health providers. It’s troubling for the president to suggest that his administration would be less responsive to any state because of differences with its governor.

We're holding our second telephone town hall now to provide an update and answer your questions about the coronavirus.

You can join us now by calling (855) 933-0829, or by going to https://t.co/8wLETtFFR5

The federal government must do more to get PPE in the hands of front-line medical staff.

First, we need to cut through the chaos: name an Emergency Medical Supply Czar to develop a unified picture of what we need and a plan to make it happen. https://t.co/rvGbo7dGNm

I am heartbroken for the family of Lansing native Kious Kelly, who died while caring for others.

Our medical professionals are the front-line troops in this conflict –– we must provide them with the armor to protect themselves while they protect us. https://t.co/cZmjEMloOj

Mr. President, we don’t need troops. We need tests. We don’t need the 82nd Airborne on our border—we need N95 masks in our hospitals.

The threat isn’t coming from our friends in Canada, it’s coming from the inability to get the supplies & equipment we need to care for the sick. https://t.co/ouYPTY80HO

Would you send our military into war without body armor?

Our heathcare workers are on the frontlines of this battle, and we need to protect them so they can protect us. 

Michigan’s delegation issued a bipartisan call to @VP to mobilize additional supplies to our state: https://t.co/GIRdEDb1Cn

I think of our frontline healthcare workers right now the way I thought of the first responders on 9/11.

And not providing them adequate personal protective equipment is like sending our troops into battle without everything that they need. https://t.co/3CPpulsZdj
All across #MI08, people are pitching in with urgently needed supplies for the front-line fight against #COVID19. Keep it coming! https://t.co/SIoAWlRoAb

Our healthcare workers are on the front lines of this conflict.
We need to treat them the way we would our frontline active duty military in a different conflict –– and get them the supplies they need to fight #COVID19.
Our new bill requires the Admin. to act under the DPA: https://t.co/VLE5Nn0PS6

The federal government's most urgent task is to accelerate the flow of vital supplies to our frontline workers.

Today @RepTimRyan, @RepJohnKatko and I are announcing the Medical Supply Chain Emergency Act, which requires the Admin. to implement the DPA to produce those supplies.
The President has named Rear Adm. John Polowczyk as the head of a @fema task force to work on getting much-needed medical supplies to the nation’s health care facilities.

I strongly support @GovWhitmer's decision to issue a “stay home, stay safe” order for our state.

This is not a decision the governor has taken likely, but let’s be clear: lives are at stake. https://t.co/uVY0y8lOpU

Good news: Michigan is now eligible for loan assistance through @SBAgov.

I’ve seen the President’s tweet about closing the northern border to non-essential traffic.

Understandably, lots of folks in Michigan have unanswered questions about what this means. I hope the administration will issue clearer communication very, very soon.

Thank you to the more than 6,000 #MI8 residents who dialed into our #COVID19 tele-town hall. We can’t gather in person right now, but we need to keep communicating. Thanks to @LtGovGilchrist and Elizabeth Hertel of @MichiganHHS for joining. The way we get through this: together.

.@GovWhitmer today notified the Small Business Admin that she is seeking emergency relief for Michigan businesses affected by #COVID19 Here’s more information about how to prepare and apply for those loans: https://t.co/QIw6WGa817

I was on Fox News this morning to encourage the Senate to act quickly on the #COVID19 support for working families we passed in the House early Saturday morning. It’s urgent that the Senate pass this help for 8th District families. https://t.co/x1SPON7oDN

.@ConsumersEnergy and @DTE_Energy will suspend utility shut-offs for low-income customers during #COVID19 crisis. Important step for working families and a sign of how we can all work together in tough times.

Early this morning, the House passed legislation to help families cope with #COVID19. Expanded sick leave & unemployment insurance isn’t just good economics – it’s good health policy. Strong bipartisan support sends an important message of unity in crisis. https://t.co/12huAGXR9a

I joined MSNBC to talk about what 8th District front line leaders are telling me they need to fight coronavirus, and what we owe the American people right now: Clarity, consistency, action and compassion. https://t.co/ixkFTqj4Vv

Today we took a final vote in the House to pass the bipartisan War Powers Resolution, which passed the Senate on February 13. This is the Senate version of the War Powers Resolution I sponsored, and that passed the House on January 9.

The next stop is the President’s desk.

I wanted to share the guidance that I issued to my congressional team yesterday on coronavirus, in line with CDC guidance, in the event it is useful for your organization.

Our goal is to maintain un-interrupted constituent services, & do our part to stem the spread of the virus: https://t.co/tyHzeud2Dq

News of two positive tests for Corona virus (COVID-19) in southeast Michigan will undoubtedly bring questions for people across the state about how to respond.

This weekend we made the second stop of our Wells and Waterways Tour at the Lansing Board of Water and Light. We’re in Davisburg tonight to talk about testing private wells & legislation like my PFAS Monitoring Act that has passed into law: https://t.co/QL2Bzj3TBZ
